title: Drag and drop connection problem
author: Cichy83
body_snippet:
OS: Windows 10 64 bit. 
After windows update (probably January 12, 2021-KB4586876 Cumulative Update Preview for .NET Framework 3.5 and 4.8 for Windows 10 Version 2004) mRemoteNg does not work properly.
mRemoteNG version:

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/65400286/107363393-5f58c500-6ada-11eb-8a25-d697cbd6ce72.png)

What am I doing:
1. Create a new folder
2. Create a new connection
3. Attempting to move the connection to the folder closes the application.

iterations.description: The issue 'Drag and drop connection problem' indicates a functional defect in a core UI interaction for connection management.

comments.author: Vest
comments.snippet:
I have tested both versions 1.76.20.24669 and the recent 1.77.3-dev build on my PC. I am afraid that I cannot reproduce the issue. Is it possible that you do something in addition (e.g. fill properties, rename the connection anything else)?
This will help us to analyze the issue in more details.

I did some brief googling here and there, it seems that people can get this exception, when they change the node, while they are dragging it, but I don't know if you do the same.

comments.snippet: I have this problem too on 1.76.20.24615.  Unable to drag connections into folders.  Windows 10 19044.1526

comments.author: robertpopa22
comments.snippet: Triage refresh (P2): this issue has been inactive for a long time. Please retest on the latest build and share reproducible steps, expected vs actual behavior, and logs/screenshots. If there is no confirmation/update, maintainers can close it as stale or not reproducible.

notes:
AI triage (gemini): The issue 'Drag and drop connection problem' indicates a functional defect in a core UI interaction for connection management.
Approach: Investigate ConnectionTreeDragAndDropHandler.cs for potential logical errors in CanModelsDrop or DropModel methods, or unintended interactions with Properties.Settings.Default.DisableTreeDragAndDrop. Also, check how ConnectionTree.cs handles the ModelDropped event and updates the UI.
